Bug.Summery: [DCR] Provide method breakpoint which condition is exception
Bug.WithStack:
R3.0
It is often that one is interesting in breaking on an exception after having obtained a stack trace. It would be thus interesting to be able to capture some of the exception context (from trace) and be able to break on this very occurrence. e.g. NullPointerExceptions may occur in quite numerous places, and be a pain to track when only interested by its occurrence in a specific context. Note that you can currently scope an exception breakpoint to a class or package (or pattern). We do not allow scoping to a method (yet). See the "Filters" page on the exception breakpoint properties. It would be interesting though to automate the definition of appropriate filters based on a given stack trace (in the same way as you provide quick navigation on these).
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 31759 ***
Bug.WithOutStack:
R3.0
It is often that one is interesting in breaking on an exception after having obtained a stack trace. It would be thus interesting to be able to capture some of the exception context (from trace) and be able to break on this very occurrence. e.g. NullPointerExceptions may occur in quite numerous places, and be a pain to track when only interested by its occurrence in a specific context. Note that you can currently scope an exception breakpoint to a class or package (or pattern). We do not allow scoping to a method (yet). See the "Filters" page on the exception breakpoint properties. It would be interesting though to automate the definition of appropriate filters based on a given stack trace (in the same way as you provide quick navigation on these).
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 31759 ***

Bug.Summery: Ragged Baseline changing fonts in TextFlow
Bug.WithStack:
After running TextFlowExample, in draw2d.examples.text, I noticed that createBaselineParagraph which is supposed to render a number of string fragments (incrementally growing in font size) aligned to a common baseline, doesn't. It produces an uneven, ragged baseline.
The baseline becomes offset, by 2 or 3 pixels above the baseline, whilst changing the font size fragments between 10 and 11pts, before the word "have".
There are also other funnies with baseline alignment exhibited in the TextFlowExample, namely when changing font or font style within a BlockFlow. Fixed. We removed the font leading at some point and now I've put it back in. For some fonts such as the default windows font leading is 0, but for bold or larger fonts leading starts to have an effect.
The result is that TextFragment.getAscent() actually represents the entire area above the baseline, including "leading". So it's a slightly different definition than ascent in FontMetrics.
Bug.WithOutStack:
After running TextFlowExample, in draw2d.examples.text, I noticed that createBaselineParagraph which is supposed to render a number of string fragments (incrementally growing in font size) aligned to a common baseline, doesn't. It produces an uneven, ragged baseline.
The baseline becomes offset, by 2 or 3 pixels above the baseline, whilst changing the font size fragments between 10 and 11pts, before the word "have".
There are also other funnies with baseline alignment exhibited in the TextFlowExample, namely when changing font or font style within a BlockFlow. Fixed. We removed the font leading at some point and now I've put it back in. For some fonts such as the default windows font leading is 0, but for bold or larger fonts leading starts to have an effect.
The result is that TextFragment.getAscent() actually represents the entire area above the baseline, including "leading". So it's a slightly different definition than ascent in FontMetrics.

Bug.Summery: Force monospace font feature (fixed width for bold and regular)

Lines.Line: 1. Seek "true monospace font" at start,
This solution increases initial cost of Eclipse.
2. Use "Courier New", and do not use their native language.
This solution decreases user experience.
3. Use "pseudo monospace font", and do not highlight with bold.
This solution decreases user experience.
4. Throw away monospace layout.
This solution decreases user experience.
Created attachment 13088
screenshot, hidemaru(Japanese famous editor)

Bug.WithStack:
Many programmers like editing a program with monospace font. Many programmers like syntax highliting with bold. However, many monospace fonts have a problems that width of bold gryph is not same as regular, like MS Gothic in Windows. Force monospace feature corrects this problem, in draw time. I believe that force monospace feature increase user experience.
Principle is simple, if font style of run is not regular, recalculate position and width of each gryph with regular style, and set these position and width to the run.
It is very easy to implement force monospace feature in win32. You may implement force monospace feature in gtk and carbon, but it is not so much easy as win32. Maybe, it is difficult to implement in motif and emulate(photon), because these platform do not have the way to operate the gryph position and width. Created attachment 12949 for org.eclipse.swt plugin
win32 only. Created attachment 12950 for org.eclipse.ui.editors plugin Created attachment 12951 for org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor plugin Created attachment 12952 for org.eclipse.jdt.ui plugin overview of patchs
for org.eclipse.swt plugin implementation of force monospace, only win32.
for org.eclipse.ui.editors plugin add a checkbox which is labeled "force monospace" to Preference->Workbench->Editors->TextEditor.
for org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor plugin support force monospace option in Preference.
for org.eclipse.jdt.ui plugin add a checkbox which is labeled "force monospace" to Preference->Workbench->Java->Editor->Appearance. Syntax preview supports force monospace. Created attachment 13082 screenshot, before patch.
Java Editor Text Font is set to "MS Gothic".
"public class" is highlighted with bold. and width of highlighted "public class" is not same as not highlighted "public_class". this screenshot is used "MS Gothic" Created attachment 13083 screenshot, after patch
Java Editor Text Font is set to "MS Gothic".
"public class" is highlighted with bold, and width of highlighted "public class" is same as not highlighted "public_class". Created attachment 13084 monospace font checker. (for J2SE 5.0)
Execute this program, then you will see the output like following.
> monospc | font family name > --------+------------------ > not | Arial > not | Arial Black > not | Batang > pseudo | BatangChe > not | Bitstream Vera Sans > true | Bitstream Vera Sans Mono
"not" intends that it is not monospace font. "true" intends that it is monospace font and regular width equals bold width. "pseudo" intends that it is monospace font, however regular width does not equal bold width.
you can execute this program with encoding names, then you will see the output like following.
> C:>java MonospaceTest ASCII > monospc | ASCII | font family name > --------+--------+------------------ > not | 76.5% | Arial > not | 76.5% | Arial Black > not | 100.0% | Batang > pseudo | 100.0% | BatangChe > not | 76.5% | Bitstream Vera Sans > true | 76.5% | Bitstream Vera Sans Mono
The Number of middle column shows percentage of displayable in specified encoding. Created attachment 13085 output of "java MonospaceTest ASCII JIS BIG5 EUCCN EUCKR"
This file is output of "java MonospaceTest ASCII JIS BIG5 EUCCN EUCKR" on my WindowsXP. It is clearly that WindowsXP has no "true monospace font" which can use with CJK characters.
If eclipse does not support this force monospace feature, 1. Seek "true monospace font" at start, This solution increases initial cost of Eclipse. 2. Use "Courier New", and do not use their native language. This solution decreases user experience. 3. Use "pseudo monospace font", and do not highlight with bold. This solution decreases user experience. 4. Throw away monospace layout. This solution decreases user experience. Created attachment 13088 screenshot, hidemaru(Japanese famous editor)
"public class" is highlighted with bold, and width of highlighted "public class" is same as not highlighted "public_class". It is same as patched screenshot. This request is same as Bug 42114, but this is not a bug.
However, many editors support a feature like force monospace feature. Current Eclipse behaviour is not satisfactory behaviour. I believe that many people hope to enhance Eclipse behaviour. I forgot that AWT can not operate bitmap font. I will attach screenshot with bitmap font which contains Japanese glyphs. (FixedSys, SmallFonts, System, Terminal) Created attachment 13095 screenshot, FixedSys
FixedSys is not monospace font. Created attachment 13096 screenshot, Small Fonts
Small Fonts is "pseudo monospace font". Created attachment 13097 screenshot, System
System is not monospace font.(same as FixedSys?) Created attachment 13098 screenshot, Terminal
Terminal is "pseudo monospace font". Created attachment 13125 screenshot, preference window
After patched, new check box which is labeled "Force monospace" is added, in preference window. If you want to enable force monospace feature, check it. The main (enabling) patch is the one which has to be applied to SWT. Moving there for comments. Once applied please move back to text.
SSQ and FH to discuss this with SN. If I read the patches properly, we are ignoring then operating system spacing for bold fonts and hammering them to be the same as regular fonts? Although it makes Eclipse look nice, it doesn't seem right to do this.
Michel, why don't you just turn bold fonts off in the Eclipse preferences and rely on coloring for key words? > If I read the patches properly, we are ignoring then operating system spacing for bold fonts and hammering them to be the same as regular fonts?
Yes, you read patches properly.
> Michel, why don't you just turn bold fonts off in the Eclipse preferences and rely on coloring for key words?
It is same as solution 3 in #9? I have said that the solution reduces user experience. If this solution can satisfy everyone, the bold option for key word highlighting is not needed. So you should eliminate the bold option for key word highlighting from Eclipse. Steve, why does Eclipse have bold option for key word highlighting? Of course, many people think it's useful. Many people who uses 'pseudo monospace font' think it's useful too and hope to use it. > it doesn't seem right to do this.
I can't understand. What's wrong? *** Bug 70817 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Steve says, "We won't override the operating system behavior, especially when there is an option in the Eclipse UI to disable bolding". This feature is expected to all usual editors. So, I think that Eclipse should support it. (it is unnecessary for people who use only ISO-8859-X, however such people is not the whole)
The most of japanese editors use more than one operating system API like my patch when rendering bold font. I cannot believe that after so many years this issue is still open. I had the very same problem with Lucida Console. Lucida Typewriter was okay, though. I do think thise patch should make it into the core product.
A little hint for all those who wonder how to work around this problem: As I explained on StackOverflow [1], Microsoft Consolas is a good choice, even in size 8, as long as you activate ClearType. Dina is also okay, but I prefer Consolas.
[1] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/145904/whats-a-the-best-small-font-for-eclipse/11041900#11041900

Bug.Summery: [Viewers] CCombo needs a viewer too (CComboViewer?)

Lines.Line: - Copy the existing unit test that tests Combo
- Make a second unit test that tests CCombo using the second example above.
- Make sure everything still runs (it ought to)
- Submit your results above.

Bug.WithStack:
Although Combo already has its viewer (ComboViewer), CCombo lacks one. It is actually enough to copy the code of ComboViewer and replace all "Combo"s with "CCombo"s and all "ComboViewer"s with "CComboViewer"s. Still it would be great if JFace could provide this viewer, so that people don't have to write it themselves. Created attachment 14504 replaced Combo with CCombo except "combo" in doc Using Eclipse Forms one is forced to use CCombo so having the CComboViewer is quite necessary. Created attachment 14638 reuse existing class but store in different instance variables
This variant avoids adding a new class to API. Would like to be able to display icons, texts with fonts and colors in the dropdown list of a combo. We prefer solution #2 but currently have nobody who is available to finish the work getting this into JFace.
Here is what needs to happen:
- Update the JFace unit tests to test the new CComboViewer.
I was going to do this but haven't had the time. If folks want this included, and someone has the time to do this, it would help a ton if you could just update the JFace unit tests as follows and submit your result as an attachment:
- Copy the existing unit test that tests Combo - Make a second unit test that tests CCombo using the second example above. - Make sure everything still runs (it ought to) - Submit your results above.
Where are the existing Combo tests? org.eclipse.jface.tests.viewers.ComboViewerTest.java was rather empty and the main method actually runs ListViewerTest from the same package. (In reply to comment #6) > Where are the existing Combo tests? > org.eclipse.jface.tests.viewers.ComboViewerTest.java was rather empty and the > main method actually runs ListViewerTest from the same package.
I have fixed the error in the main method, but typically we don't use the main to run tests (instead: Run As->JUnit Test or JUnit Plug-in Test).
ComboViewerTest inherits about 25 test methods from its superclass.
We are going to do a widget independant Table for 3.3 - any solution we should do should follow the same route in case there is another Combo in the future that may want to create it's own viewer. ComboViewer inherits from AbstractListViewer which is already widget-independent. All we need is a test for the CCombo case (should be very easy - see comments 5,6,7). Patch #2 released with minor edits (contribution comment, @since tags, minor change to Javadoc of getCombo and getCCombo). I created a new test class by subclassing StructuredViewerTest. Sebastian, thanks for your patch. See bug 91666 for how to decide between Combo and CCombo. Verified in source code, using I20061213-0800.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Although Combo already has its viewer (ComboViewer), CCombo lacks one. It is actually enough to copy the code of ComboViewer and replace all "Combo"s with "CCombo"s and all "ComboViewer"s with "CComboViewer"s. Still it would be great if JFace could provide this viewer, so that people don't have to write it themselves. Created attachment 14504 replaced Combo with CCombo except "combo" in doc Using Eclipse Forms one is forced to use CCombo so having the CComboViewer is quite necessary. Created attachment 14638 reuse existing class but store in different instance variables
This variant avoids adding a new class to API. Would like to be able to display icons, texts with fonts and colors in the dropdown list of a combo. We prefer solution #2 but currently have nobody who is available to finish the work getting this into JFace.
Here is what needs to happen:
- Update the JFace unit tests to test the new CComboViewer.
I was going to do this but haven't had the time. If folks want this included, and someone has the time to do this, it would help a ton if you could just update the JFace unit tests as follows and submit your result as an attachment:
- Copy the existing unit test that tests Combo - Make a second unit test that tests CCombo using the second example above. - Make sure everything still runs (it ought to) - Submit your results above.
Where are the existing Combo tests? org.eclipse.jface.tests.viewers.ComboViewerTest.java was rather empty and the main method actually runs ListViewerTest from the same package. (In reply to comment #6) > Where are the existing Combo tests? > org.eclipse.jface.tests.viewers.ComboViewerTest.java was rather empty and the > main method actually runs ListViewerTest from the same package.
I have fixed the error in the main method, but typically we don't use the main to run tests (instead: Run As->JUnit Test or JUnit Plug-in Test).
ComboViewerTest inherits about 25 test methods from its superclass.
We are going to do a widget independant Table for 3.3 - any solution we should do should follow the same route in case there is another Combo in the future that may want to create it's own viewer. ComboViewer inherits from AbstractListViewer which is already widget-independent. All we need is a test for the CCombo case (should be very easy - see comments 5,6,7). Patch #2 released with minor edits (contribution comment, @since tags, minor change to Javadoc of getCombo and getCCombo). I created a new test class by subclassing StructuredViewerTest. Sebastian, thanks for your patch. See bug 91666 for how to decide between Combo and CCombo. Verified in source code, using I20061213-0800.

Bug.Summery: [Preferences] Preferencelook changed
Bug.WithStack:
It seems that the motif-TK have Problems with the height and width of the Preferences-Window if the user choose a preference-window with windows who needs more place on the screen.
to show the Effects just do the following (New Eclipse) 1 open Window->Preferences 2 choose Workbench->Keys 3 close Preferenes - Dialog 4 reopen Preferences -Dialog
then new created Window is much taller than thar from step 1 and shows more details
It's not possible to see the whole Dialog without the sequence open->chose->close->reopen Created attachment 12953 shows the Dialog with in a to small window Created attachment 12954 shows the whole Dialog This is by design (it has always been this way - some of the preference pages may have changed). We size when we need to but avoid shrinking the dialog.
Bug.WithOutStack:
It seems that the motif-TK have Problems with the height and width of the Preferences-Window if the user choose a preference-window with windows who needs more place on the screen.

then new created Window is much taller than thar from step 1 and shows more details

We size when we need to but avoid shrinking the dialog.

Bug.Summery: Target navigation for Ant editor
Bug.WithStack:
In Java editor you can push F3 to jump into the definition of the element under cursor. It will be very convenient to have similar feature for Ant editor:
-- Jump into the property definition (ideally it should also resolve properties loaded from the external file and allow to choose which one you want to jump to)
-- Target definition (from project/@default, target/@depends, ant/@target, antcall/@target). This can be even configurable, so user can add custom/optional tasks into the list, e.g. to support for-each task).
Thank you. There are several ant tasks that may accept class as one of the parameters (e.g. "java"), so it would be handy to be able to jump into that class. However similar functionality is awailable in Any Edit Tools plugin. http://andrei.gmxhome.de/anyedit/ I am going to break this bug up as the implementation details for the enhancements are varied.
This bug will remain for the target definition navigation.
Created bug 75759 for property navigation Created bug 75760 for Java class navigation Added F3 navigation for targets in Ant buildfiles. Changes to AntEditor and AntModel. Please verify Luc. Verified. Please update the build notes, Darin S. Thanks. Build notes updated.
Bug.WithOutStack:
In Java editor you can push F3 to jump into the definition of the element under cursor. It will be very convenient to have similar feature for Ant editor:
-- Jump into the property definition (ideally it should also resolve properties loaded from the external file and allow to choose which one you want to jump to)
-- Target definition (from project/@default, target/@depends, ant/@target, antcall/@target). This can be even configurable, so user can add custom/optional tasks into the list, e.g. to support for-each task).
Thank you. There are several ant tasks that may accept class as one of the parameters (e.g. "java"), so it would be handy to be able to jump into that class. However similar functionality is awailable in Any Edit Tools plugin. http://andrei.gmxhome.de/anyedit/ I am going to break this bug up as the implementation details for the enhancements are varied.
This bug will remain for the target definition navigation.
Created bug 75759 for property navigation Created bug 75760 for Java class navigation Added F3 navigation for targets in Ant buildfiles. Changes to AntEditor and AntModel. Please verify Luc. Verified. Please update the build notes, Darin S. Thanks. Build notes updated.

Bug.Summery: Better completion in Ant editor: location properties
Bug.WithStack:
Ant can handle different types for properties: value, location, refId. It is strongly recommended to use location to specify any references to the files or directories and it is also common practice to extend location properties, e.g. ${lib.dir}/log4j.jar. So, completion can recognize location properties and offer to choice files and directories at given location. We provide assistance for refId.
You are asking to be provided with all other location properties as possible completions when definining the location attribute for a new property? Actually I'm asking to enable completion for file names. :) Ok :-) that begs the question...where would I get a list of filenames to present to the user? Well, I guess in the same place where Ant would get the actual files. Usually build.xml reside in the right place and you can start from the current dir, unless there is a prefix, that is loaded from external .properties or specified in another local property... unfortunately this feature will not be implemented for 3.1 As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Ant can handle different types for properties: value, location, refId. It is strongly recommended to use location to specify any references to the files or directories and it is also common practice to extend location properties, e.g. ${lib.dir}/log4j.jar. So, completion can recognize location properties and offer to choice files and directories at given location. We provide assistance for refId.
You are asking to be provided with all other location properties as possible completions when definining the location attribute for a new property? Actually I'm asking to enable completion for file names. :) Ok :-) that begs the question...where would I get a list of filenames to present to the user? Well, I guess in the same place where Ant would get the actual files. Usually build.xml reside in the right place and you can start from the current dir, unless there is a prefix, that is loaded from external .properties or specified in another local property... unfortunately this feature will not be implemented for 3.1 As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: [Import/Export] Could use jobs to allow for completion of input name.
Bug.WithStack:
Please add completion drop-down to the entry fields that requires to type file/directory name (e.g. Project Import Wizard/Project Content field, New Project Wizard/ External Location, New file/Advanced/Link to the file system, etc). It should proide a choice of the files/directories for current location, so it will be possible to save some time and don't use "Browse" button in most of the cases.
This feature is supported natively on Windows 2000/XP in all Open/Choice directory/Save as... dialogs. The problem with doing this for import especially is that we would have to read a directory every time qwe did it (thats why we only do it when the entry field loses focus).
The performance hit outweighs the convenience. Tod, I'd like to suggest a workarround for this. You can start reading directory only when user actually typed some char, this will limit the number of matched files/dirs.
If you still think that it will hit a performance, then please read directory and show a drop-down with the result only if user hit a special shorcut (e.g. Ctrl-Space like in other places). This approach will also work for me. I truly believe that performance hit of this will be way less then forcing user to open browse dialog, which could be quite slow by itself. I really hate to wait when directory chooser on windows walks trough all network drives to capture drive labels or some other information. :-( This is exactly what we did and the problem is that we have to populate a whole table to do it. The way we could do it is to follw the same population algorithm as the table viewer - that is to do it as a background job that can be cancelled when anotehr keystroke comes in.
I'll leave this open as with the jobs support the method you suggest is possible now and I'll rename the report appropriately. Thanks Tod. I just want to point out that in most cases it should not be an issue, because size of the result will be within 5..10 choices, because it is only per current directory, basically last "\". And if you'll go with a custom triggerred drop-down (e.g. user hit Ctrl-Space), it will be explicit action that is called by the user, so performance should not be an issue at all, because user asked for that action. The performance issue is actually updating the table when you do get a valid entry BTW. Hmm, it is sound strange. Entire table should be fetched completely at that moment user hit "/" it will include all files in the directory, so when result it shown, it can be probably filtered in memory without rereading if from the disk on the next keystroke. There colud be some logic around that to save some roundtrips to the disk (if it will be necessary), and again it only happens when user requested it by hitting a Ctrl-Space it should not be an issue. The "text field + browse button" metaphor is pervasive within apps built on Eclipse. If someone wants to take a stab at providing the functionality described here, we would be happy to discuss it with them, but it would need to be done in a way that doesn't introduce inconsistencies (e.g. it works in platform dialogs but not in ones provided by the other plug-ins).
In general, we rely on the native dialogs to provide the optimizations that make sense on each platform. "As per http://wiki.eclipse.org/Platform_UI/Bug_Triage_Change_2009"

Bug.Summery: TestSearchEngine.hasSuiteMethod(IType) does not consider return type [JUnit]
"Transport dt_socket failed to initialize" on JDK 1.5.0 beta 2
Bug.WithStack:
I've just attempted to do a debug with 3.0 (just downloaded after returning from JavaOne) and I am getting this error:
FATAL ERROR in native method: No transports initialized Transport dt_socket failed to initialize, rc = 509.
I am using Windows XP SP1. I have been using Eclipse since 1.0 and have never had a problem until I installed 3.0.
I just tested with 2.1.3 and the debugging works just file there.
I have deleted all my external plugins, the configurations subdirectory under Eclipse and created a new workspace. I created a brand new project, with a new class (HelloWorld) and it does exactly the same thing and I get the exact same error.
I am not running any local FireWall and there is this entry in the log:
!MESSAGE Cannot connect to VM
I am running under JDK 1.5 beta 2 and use the following startup command:
C:\apps\eclipse3x\eclipse.exe -data C:\apps\workspace30 -vm c:\apps\jdk14\jre\bin\javaw -vmargs -Xmx512m Additionally, this is the stack trace found in the log:
java.net.SocketException: socket closed at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketAccept(Native Method) at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.accept(PlainSocketImpl.java:353) at java.net.ServerSocket.implAccept(ServerSocket.java:448) at java.net.ServerSocket.accept(ServerSocket.java:419) at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketTransportImpl.accept(SocketTransportImpl.java:87) at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketListeningConnectorImpl.accept(SocketListeningConnectorImpl.java:124) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMDebugger$ConnectRunnable.run(StandardVMDebugger.java:78) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534) JDK 1.5 is not yet supported by Eclipse. Do you have the same problem running 1.4.2? Cannot reproduce. I can launch Eclipse 3.0 on JDK 1.4.2 and debug on JDK 1.5 beta 2 no problem. Are you getting this problem consistently? If so, have you tried starting over from scratch with a new Eclipse 3.0 install (as opposed to installing and then deleting plugins)? It shouldn't make any difference, but it would be good to try. From bug 44270 comment 11 and 12, it looks like your VM installation is messed up such that the debug libraries aren't present. Did you install a JRE instead of a JDK? If not, you might have got a bad download or something. I'd try grabbing the JDK again and re-installing. I uninstalled 1.5 and used the 1.4 install and debugging does again work. I thought the use of the -vm should force Eclipse to startup the specified JVM, with was 1.4.2_04. Does that not work?

Bug.Summery: [content assist] Argument List - suggest what's already there
Bug.WithStack:
Frequently, I have a line that read
foo.getBar(123);
I'll select "Bar" and use Ctrl-space to popup a list of other methods, and select another method. When I do, with the right preferences set, it will fill in "default values" for the parameter(s). It should ALWAYS offer the parameter list that is there, if there is one. That is, in this case, "123" should be a choice.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 63366 ***

Bug.Summery: MacOSX support for HEAD
Bug.WithStack:
Here is a first cut of MacOS X support for HEAD (as of 7/4/04). It adds Mach-O binary support, including dylib and archives. It's based off the ELF code. I'm happy to support this, so bugs can be directed to me. Created attachment 12955 UI patch Created attachment 12956 ManagedBuilder UI patch Created attachment 12957 ManagedBuilder Core patch Created attachment 12958 Core patch Created attachment 12959 MacOSX feature Thanks, Greg! I'll review these and try to get them in this week. I'll also turn on Mac builds as part of our nightly builds for 2.1 (off of HEAD). I'll also take you up on your offer and fire defects your way. I have committed the patch. The only change I made was to the default Scanner config to make sure it didn't use the Windows version which makes a call to Cygwin's cygpath utility (which, of course, isn't there). I'll try this out for a while and fire defects your way as I see them.
Thanks again! Updating the status.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Here is a first cut of MacOS X support for HEAD (as of 7/4/04). It adds Mach-O binary support, including dylib and archives. It's based off the ELF code. I'm happy to support this, so bugs can be directed to me. Created attachment 12955 UI patch Created attachment 12956 ManagedBuilder UI patch Created attachment 12957 ManagedBuilder Core patch Created attachment 12958 Core patch Created attachment 12959 MacOSX feature Thanks, Greg! I'll review these and try to get them in this week. I'll also turn on Mac builds as part of our nightly builds for 2.1 (off of HEAD). I'll also take you up on your offer and fire defects your way. I have committed the patch. The only change I made was to the default Scanner config to make sure it didn't use the Windows version which makes a call to Cygwin's cygpath utility (which, of course, isn't there). I'll try this out for a while and fire defects your way as I see them.
Thanks again! Updating the status.

Bug.Summery: ant javac cannot find compiler
Bug.WithStack:
Starting eclipse 3.0 with a JRE, running ant in workbench jre, using the default ant classpath which automatically includes what looks like the correct tools.jar, I still get this message:
BUILD FAILED: D:\workspace\espresso\build.xml:79: Unable to find a javac compiler; com.sun.tools.javac.Main is not on the classpath. Perhaps JAVA_HOME does not point to the JDK
${java.class.path} is set to "java.class.path = D:\eclipse_3.0\startup.jar" ${project.class.path} is not set.
Adding the same tools.jar as an external jar works, but should not be nessesary since it is already listed under "Additional tasks & support".
Starting eclipse with "-vm" and a JDK solves the problem, but should not be nessesary. Move to Platform/Ant What tools.jar is included on the Ant runtime classpath? Is it resolved from the JAVA_HOME environment variable?
I cannot reproduce your problem. The tools.jar is resolved from the JRE settings of the ANT "External Tools" setting. I have not set the JAVA_HOME environment variable outside Eclipse. I run ANT in the same JRE as Eclipse to get console input.
Sorry, now I am confused :-) You state that you are running Eclipse using a JRE (not a JDK so no tools.jar) You state that you are running the ant build in the same JRE as Eclipse (still no tools.jar). I don't see where the tools.jar is coming from?
My apologies :) I am running Eclipse from a JDK, with a tools.jar. I am running the ant build in the same JRE as Eclipse (the JRE included in the JDK). The tools.jar is automatically discovered from the JDK, but cannot be found when using the <javac> ant task.
I cannot reproduce the problem. I get a tools.jar on all classpaths and all javacs work as expected. your report is not consistent: comment #1: running Eclipse using a JRE, problem fixed if use -vm to point to JDK
comment #5: running Eclipse using a JDK. Are you pointing to a diff JDK install when you use -vm as stated in comment #1?
If there is anything else you could add to help in reproduction of the problem that would be greatly appreciated. I just tried it again with Eclipse 3.1M1, and it seems to work fine. Maybe it is fixed or maybe my setup was at fault. Anyway, you may close the bug as fixed :) I hope I didn't waste your time. Thanks for reporting back. I believe this was a user configuration problem as we have not changed any code in this area.

Bug.Summery: project name stored in .project-file is not honored when checking-out
Bug.WithStack:
hi,
if a project is stored in cvs in a folder called "abc", and the .project-file inside that folder says, that the name is "def", than i'd expect the checked out project to be named "def" and not "abc". instead, the project is always called like the folder, and i have to override it manually. I suspect that this has always been the case - since 1.0. the first point is, that the name of the project, and the .project file aren't consistent anymore. The project is named "abc", but the .project file says "def".
In addition, names of projects are important, since they are shared among the developers of a team, that share their projects via CVS vor example.
Also see Bug 69268. There is nothing we can do about this from a team/CVS standpoint. I'm moving this to Core. The project name is the .project file is ignored so I suspect it will be marked as WONTFIX. A workaround is to use the synchronize view and perform a Remove from View on the .project file when you check out a project using a different name and aprojetc description change dirties the file. If you perform all your future commits from the synchronize view, they will always exclude the .project. If you use "Check Out As..." from the CVS Repositories view, you can use whatever name you want for the local project.

The project is named "abc", but the .project file says "def".
In addition, names of projects are important, since they are shared among the developers of a team, that share their projects via CVS vor example.
Also see Bug 69268. There is nothing we can do about this from a team/CVS standpoint. I'm moving this to Core. The project name is the .project file is ignored so I suspect it will be marked as WONTFIX. A workaround is to use the synchronize view and perform a Remove from View on the .project file when you check out a project using a different name and aprojetc description change dirties the file. If you perform all your future commits from the synchronize view, they will always exclude the .project. If you use "Check Out As..." from the CVS Repositories view, you can use whatever name you want for the local project.

Bug.Summery: project-names shouldn't be references by .classpath files
Bug.WithStack:
It is problematic, that the project-names are referenced in .classpath files. I'd like random IDs better, since that way project-dependencies could be shared with other people in a team. The way it is now, all people in a team have to have the same project-names to be abled to do that. What would this random ID be then and how could it be shared amongst developpers ? The Project-ID could be an addition property of a project. It than must be stored in the .project file and referenced by the .classpath files instead of the project names.
The Project-ID would be a 32-bit (or longer) integer value, and it would be chosen by random if a project is created. Even among diffenrent computers, there shouldn't be much collisions. BTW: i assume that the .project file is shared among the developers. I also filed Bug 69267 since the project-name isn't really honoured when a project is checked out. So the project-names are pretty much the badest thing to use for a file like .classpath which is shared among many developers in a team. Then, once you checked out a project. It references subsequent projects, and only tells you about unbound IDs. How can you figure the missing ones, do you check them all out ? Having the name show up is likely a very good hint for your teammates, and you simply agree that people should change the name on checkout (unless they want to fixup all dependent project classpaths). OK, but than Bug 69267 should be "fixed". Either make Eclipse keeping the name of the project and the project-name in the .project-file consistent, or don't store the project-name in the .project file, since it isn't necessarily used by Eclipse. Comment#4 should have been reading: "[...] you simply agree that people should NOT change the name on checkout [...]".
Bug 69267 looks like a real inconsistency, which is misleading I believe.
Closing this one, since no action is planned on the build path.

Bug.Summery: Provide a way to edit profiling set description
Bug.WithStack:
Currently there is no way to edit the profiling set description, so when a user create a new one, its description are all set to be the same and not editable. However, we should disable the edit option if the profiling set are predefine ones. Actually it is possible, but it's in a bad place (click "Rename...") to rename the set; it also lets you edit the description. It seems odd to me that the user has to go to different places to edit different parts of the profiling set. That is, the name and description are done via Rename, but the content is via Edit. We should consider putting all these in the same edit dialog.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 74335 *** closing bug

We should consider putting all these in the same edit dialog.

Bug.Summery: decimal integer literals should not consist of FULL WIDTH Unicode digits
Bug.WithStack:
In JLS decimal integer literals consist of only 0, 1, 2,... and 9. But JDT compiler also allows FULL WIDTH digits(U+FF10...U+FF19). Please provide a testcase. Created attachment 12962 An example of integer literal which JLS does not allow
This code, which Eclipse 3.0(Build 200406251208) compiles without complaining anything, should not be compiled, because decimal literals(10) are written in full width digits(U+FF10..U+FF19) while JLS(Java Language Specification) specifies decimal integer literals only consists of 0..9. [http://java.sun.com/docs/books/jls/second_edition/html/lexical.doc.html#48282]
Full width digits appear in JIS(Japanese Industrial Standards) X 0208 and adopted into Unicode for compatibility use only. Character.isDigit returns true for these digits. We use Character.isDigit(...) to find out if we have a digit. I will double-check the specs. We should replace all calls to Character.isDigit with the following code: private boolean isDigit(char c) throws InvalidInputException { if (Character.isDigit(c)) { switch(c) { case '0' : case '1' : case '2' : case '3' : case '4' : case '5' : case '6' : case '7' : case '8' : case '9' : return true; } throw new InvalidInputException(Scanner.INVALID_DIGIT); } else { return false; } } Fixed and released in HEAD. Regression test added. Should address in 3.0.1 stream as well. The fix is ready to be released in the 3_0_maintenance. In 3.0.1, the error will be an invalid input. In 3.1, it will be an invalid digit. Fixed and released in 3_0_maintenance. Regression test added. Verified for 3.0.1 RC1

[http://java.sun.com/docs/books/jls/second_edition/html/lexical.doc.html#48282]

A clue to the first behaviour I have observed: It happens when I edit the code in a view belonging to the "Visual Editor". If I edit it in a regular Java View, it doesn't happen.
The 2nd problem also happens with a Java view. My previous comment isn't true, the bug isn't specific to the Visual Editor. I tried many times and use the editors on a daily basis and cannot reproduce on fresh Eclipse SDK 3.0. Please reopen with steps to reproduce if you see this in a fresh Eclipse SDK environment (comment 4 shows that several non-SDK plug-ins have been installed).
Think this bug is a duplicated for 57868 I have turned off folding as suggested in the description of that bug. Well, it cannot be a duplicate since the bug is marked as fixed for 3.0.
You didn't tell us how you select i.e. whether you use Ctrl+ (see comment 0), so how exactly do you select line 265 to 270?
If folding is disabled then it works but when it is enabled it does not work, right? Is something folded when opening the attached file?
Best would be to provide exact steps based on plain Eclipse SDK. Conclusions:
1) It does not depend on the method you use to invoke copy: main menu, Ctrl+C, Ctrl+insert 2) Happens only with Java editors 3) Happens quite often 4) Cut fails more than the equivalent combination Copy+Delete 5) Cheetah plugin isn't installed. When I copy some code and paste it in another file, the necessary imports are pasted, but nothing else. External programs view the clipboard as empty.
Does this provide any light of what it may be the cause? Please answer all the questions that I asked before reopening.
Get rid of deprecated state. .

Bug.Summery: [Javadoc] Invalid warning on @see link
Bug.WithStack: I have the following JavaDoc: /**@see Documentación externa*/ static String traduceFormatoFechaInformix(String fmt) { .... } The following error is reported: JavaDoc: Invalid reference I think it is correct, look at the spec: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/tooldocs/windows/javadoc.html#@see Text is not allowed after a @see link reference, but compiler should not complain when these text is the end of comment... Fixed. Compiler does not longer complain on this syntax. [jdt-core-internal] Change done in AbstractCommentParser.parseComment(int,int). Test cases added in JavadocTestMixed and ASTConverterJavadocTest. Released in HEAD. Verified for 3.0.1 RC1
Bug.WithOutStack: I have the following JavaDoc: /**@see Documentación externa*/ static String traduceFormatoFechaInformix(String fmt) { .... } The following error is reported: JavaDoc: Invalid reference I think it is correct, look at the spec: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/tooldocs/windows/javadoc.html#@see Text is not allowed after a @see link reference, but compiler should not complain when these text is the end of comment... Fixed. Compiler does not longer complain on this syntax. [jdt-core-internal] Change done in AbstractCommentParser.parseComment(int,int). Test cases added in JavadocTestMixed and ASTConverterJavadocTest. Released in HEAD. Verified for 3.0.1 RC1

Bug.Summery: [formatting] missing line break after custom Javadoc tag without parameters
Bug.WithStack:
From bug 45465 comment 20 and 21:
Before formatting (ctrl-shift-F) /** * @ejb.bean name="TestServer" * type="Stateless" * view-type="remote" * jndi-name="ejb/TestServerHome" * @ejb.remote-facade * @ejb.util generate="physical" */
After formatting (ctrl-shift-F) /** * @ejb.bean name="TestServer" type="Stateless" view-type="remote" * jndi-name="ejb/TestServerHome" * @ejb.remote-facade @ejb.util generate="physical" */
I can live with the rearrangement of the @ejb.bean tag. But, placing @ejb.remote-facade and @ejb.util on the same line breaks XDoclet.
Update (workaround): If the positions of the @ejb.util and @ejb.remote-facade are swaped formatting turns out ok. The bug seems to appear when the @tag has no value associated with it.
Before formatting: /** * @ejb.bean name="TestServer" * type="Stateless" * view-type="remote" * jndi-name="ejb/TestServerHome" * @ejb.util generate="physical" * @ejb.remote-facade */
After formatting: /** * @ejb.bean name="TestServer" type="Stateless" view-type="remote" * jndi-name="ejb/TestServerHome" * @ejb.util generate="physical" * @ejb.remote-facade */
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 68577 ***

Bug.Summery: Code completion (ctrl-space) current selection is not highlighted properly
Bug.WithStack:
When pressing CTRL-SPACE in a java or build.xml file, a list of suggestions for text to be inserted appears. The first line is selected, but only with the "inactive" color, a very pale grey. It should be highlighted properly with white text on blue background.
Clicking once on the selected item makes it properly highlighted, but should not be nessessary.
As it is, the selected item is practically indistinguisable (sp?) from the other items, which makes it hard to use this feature using only the keyboard.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 64861 ***
Bug.WithOutStack:
When pressing CTRL-SPACE in a java or build.xml file, a list of suggestions for text to be inserted appears. The first line is selected, but only with the "inactive" color, a very pale grey. It should be highlighted properly with white text on blue background.
Clicking once on the selected item makes it properly highlighted, but should not be nessessary.
As it is, the selected item is practically indistinguisable (sp?) from the other items, which makes it hard to use this feature using only the keyboard.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 64861 ***

Bug.Summery: [KeyBindings] Conflicting keybindings: Should try all commands until one is handled
Bug.WithStack:
Eclipse 3.0 diables a keybinding when the same keySequence with the same contextId is registered more than once. We could do better in such cases:
There should be a defined sequence for trying all of the conflicting handler submissions (e.g. depth-first traversal in the plugin-dependencies tree). When a handler submission has set the "handled" attribute to false, the next handler should be tried, etc., until a handler has handled the shortcut.
[This is part (a) of bug 33161 comment 8.] Can you give a concrete example? I tried to hack a plugin which contributes a "Select All" handler for all Tree and Table widgets to the keybinding Ctrl+A.
I used ... <command name="Select All" description="Select all items in a Tree or a Table" categoryId="org.eclipse.ui.category.widget" id="tree.key.selectall"> </command> <handlerSubmission commandId="tree.key.selectall" handler="tree.key.SelectAllHandler" /> <keyBinding commandId="tree.key.selectall" contextId="org.eclipse.ui.contexts.dialogAndWindow" keyConfigurationId="org.eclipse.ui.defaultAcceleratorConfiguration" keySequence="Ctrl+A"> </keyBinding>
... to contribute my subclass of AbstractHandler. In getAttributeValuesByName(), I set the attribute "handled" to false iff the current focus control is not a Table or a Tree.
I expected the keyboard/command service to fall through the first handler and try the second one iff there are multiple handlers for the same contextId. The handled attribute is a hack to support the migration of RetargetAction to the commands architecture. It is meant to avoid swallowing the key, but not to provide a fallthrough mechanism. I'm sorry that this isn't better documented.
Why don't you want to use the default select all handler? No response. Closing as WORKSFORME. Please re-open if this is still a problem.

Bug.Summery: Undesirable traces from the tester on standard output
Bug.WithStack: When executing a test using the Test Execution Harness with the default Data Processor, the traces sent by the tester to the host are printed to the standard output console. These traces are usually not visible to the user when Eclipse is launched from a shortcut, but they are if it is launched from a console, as it is rather common on UNIX systems. They may be huge if the tester runs for a long time. Another drawback is that theses traces are slowing down the data processor's job. This is likely a regression since these traces didn't use to appear until recently. Fixed in HEAD and v3_0_1 branch Closing...
Bug.WithOutStack: When executing a test using the Test Execution Harness with the default Data Processor, the traces sent by the tester to the host are printed to the standard output console. These traces are usually not visible to the user when Eclipse is launched from a shortcut, but they are if it is launched from a console, as it is rather common on UNIX systems. They may be huge if the tester runs for a long time. Another drawback is that theses traces are slowing down the data processor's job. This is likely a regression since these traces didn't use to appear until recently. Fixed in HEAD and v3_0_1 branch Closing...

Bug.Summery: Line separator

Lines.Line: - which build?
- which editor is used to open the file?
- what does "edit" mean e.g. open *.java file, add space, save?

Bug.WithStack:
I have existing .java files with standard Windows line separator "\r\n". When I edit it with Eclipse, line separator for modified lines are changed for "\n". This confuses me, because if I leave these lines as before, when comparing with the latest version in SourceSafe, differences are reported (the line separators).
This didn't happen in Eclipse 2.1
Couldn't it use the same line separator used originally in the file? >Couldn't it use the same line separator used originally in the file? That would be the idea.
Can you add more details: - which build? - which editor is used to open the file? - what does "edit" mean e.g. open *.java file, add space, save?
Please reopen after answering above questions. I've done some checks and seems to work ok. I'll report if I see something strange. Get rid of deprecated state. .

Bug.Summery: [Help Wanted] problem in Debugging C/C++ projects with Eclipse 3.0 on HP/UX
Bug.WithStack:
Hello open source world,
I am using the Latest Eclipse build (Build Id:-200406301200) with compatible CDT plugins on Linux platform. When I try debugging a C or C++ project, I am getting the following error.
"Launching (Error: Target request failed: Target is not responding(timed out).)
However, there was no such problem with the earlier releases.
I have the latest version of debugger. May I know what causes this problem.
Please help me to make it work.
Thanks in advance, Ragav. PR was not targeted to any particular release. Changing target milestone to 2.1 Created attachment 13046 log file
Have attached the log file for more details. Created attachment 13050 log file
Have attached the log file for more details. Please check your path to make sure you have a version of gdb that is 5.2.1 or later versions. You can verify by typing: # gdb -i mi1
In the CDT FAQ web pages it describes a way to get the output of gdb via trace logging, I would like to see this. So far, I do not have enough information on what is a problem to be of good help.
Thanks
I've look at the the trace and it seems to work ok.
However, you seem to have the disassembly view on. Turn this off for the test, i.e. do not use the disassembly view. that will help us isolate the problem. Do the normal next/next.
what is of surpise to me is this:
[1,089,778,307,755] 30-exec-continue [1,089,778,307,770] I AM FOO I AM BAR (gdb)=20 [1,089,778,307,771] 30^running [1,089,778,307,771] (gdb)=20 [1,089,778,307,771] 30*stopped [1,089,778,307,774] 31 info threads [1,089,778,307,774] (gdb)=20 [1,089,778,307,775] &"info threads\n" [1,089,778,307,775] &"No stack.\n" [1,089,778,307,776] 31^error,msg=3D"No stack." [1,089,778,307,776] 32 info threads [1,089,778,307,777] (gdb)=20
After the print out, the program stop for unknown reason, just "*stopped" for unknown reasons or it reach the end.
With the disassembly off is it working better ?
Vlad/Mathieu Do you have an HP machine to quickly run hello_world type of program on the debugger ? We do not have any HP machine here, so debugging this is extremmely painfull. If an hello_world type of program does not work, could you send me the MI log trace ...
Note: you need gdb-5.2.1 or newer on HP
Thanks Created attachment 13546 HP-UX SOM Binary parser patch
HP-UX SOM Binary parser patch I was not able to make Debugging work in CDT 2.0 GA on HP-UX because there is only one Debugger available in the C/C++ Local configuration and that is GDB Server. When I was trying to debug the HelloWorld application with this debugger I was getting errors (same as Ragav, and some similar ones).
Then I applied a quick fix to the new HP-UX SOM binary parser and got GDB Debugger as well, which worked just fine.
Attached are the patch and the GDB trace output of successful debugging session. The patch is applicable to both HEAD and the branch. Created attachment 13547 GDB session output I have narrowed down the problem to MIPlugin.java Line No:166 (see the attached file). In this code, there are two blocks one if pty == null and other for pty ! =null.
If pty !=null, then tty and pty.getSlaveName() is sent as parameters and libpty.so comes into action.
If pty = null , then tty and pty.getSlaveName() is not available as parameters and libpty.so does not come into action.
When I encountered this "Target not responding" exception, I drilled down that this happens because of the two arguments tty and pty.getSlaveName() and then commented them out from the code. The debugger worked perflectly fine. Now I got confused , if the debugger works perfectly fine without these tty options then why should we have this code. I am sure I am missing something. Can you set me the right context? I perfectly understand that by setting the "tty", we redirect our gdb output to Eclipse console rather than the pseudo terminal or standart input/output. Well this problem occurs even in Eclipse 3.0 + CDT 2.0.
Created attachment 13556 Attachment for comment 10 > if the debugger works perfectly fine without these tty options > then why should we have this code. I am sure I am missing something. Can you > set me the right context?
As you pointed out, the PTY support is to redirect the output to the console(Eclipse) and also some applications __need__ a TTY stream to work/behave etc ...
Some platforms do not have PTY(See org.eclipse.cdt.core.win32) and do not provide a libpty.so. It looks like the pty handling is not working for HP. We could fix the code or remove the pty.so completely.
Doug/vlad what do you think ? Unfortunately we do not have HP machines here to commit to fix this code, somebody else will have to step in.
> Attached are the patch and the GDB trace output of successful debugging > session. The patch is applicable to both HEAD and the branch.
Thanks Vlad, another PR was created to track this down:
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=70820
Is there any progress done with this PR. Ragav, was saying that the PTY handling code is buggy,
We don't have HP here, so it will be up the folks having HP boxes to provide a fix for this . I'm pretty sure HP has a lot of HP machines around :-). Guys, please feel free to send in patches to make the CDT work better on your platforms. We'll be happy to review them and apply them as necessary.
Just for the record, there is no HP version of libpty.so because there is no org.eclipse.cdt.core.hpux fragment. Therefore pty is always equal to null so tty and pty.getSlaveName() never make it to the argument list. I am not quite clear why it was necessary to remove them from the code.
Still I was able to debug an application (even without HP-UX binary parser) using GDB Debugger (not Server) launch configuration.
> Just for the record, there is no HP version of libpty.so because there is no > org.eclipse.cdt.core.hpux fragment. Therefore pty is always equal to null so > tty and pty.getSlaveName() never make it to the argument list. I am not quite > clear why it was necessary to remove them from the code.
Agreed.
> Still I was able to debug an application (even without HP-UX binary parser) > using GDB Debugger (not Server) launch configuration.
Allright cool!
Thanks vlad.
No feedback for the reporter, unblocking and moving to future No one is currently looking at HP/UX support.

Bug.Summery: [navigation] failing Last Edit Position scenario

Lines.Line: - add an unused import
- make a change at another position (refered to as position 1) in the document
- go to another position (refered to as position 2) in the document
- organize import
- go to yet another position
- invoke Last Edit Position
-> goes to position 2 where the organize import was invoked (I'd expect it to go
to the removed import)

Bug.WithStack:
3.0
In a CU: - add an unused import - make a change at another position (refered to as position 1) in the document - go to another position (refered to as position 2) in the document - organize import - go to yet another position - invoke Last Edit Position -> goes to position 2 where the organize import was invoked (I'd expect it to go to the removed import)
The AbstractTextEditor.TextListener updates the last edit position based on the selection. The selection can differ from the position of the acctual document change.
Bug.WithOutStack:
3.0
In a CU: - add an unused import - make a change at another position (refered to as position 1) in the document - go to another position (refered to as position 2) in the document - organize import - go to yet another position - invoke Last Edit Position -> goes to position 2 where the organize import was invoked (I'd expect it to go to the removed import)
The AbstractTextEditor.TextListener updates the last edit position based on the selection. The selection can differ from the position of the acctual document change.

Bug.Summery: [implementation] AnnotationModel not thread-safe

Lines.Line: - Set a breakpoint in ProjectionSummary#internalUpdateSummaries(..) at first call to "sync.setLockObject(..)" (line 164)
- Set a breakpoint in BracketInserterTest#testMultiplePeerEntry() at
- Set breakpoint in AnnotationMap#keySetIterator() inside the synchronized block (line 82)

- Resume the main thread a few times until the 'this' variable has the id you've written down before. WARNING: The Debug view tries sometimes steals your selection and selects the ProjectionSummary thread (bug 229536). Be careful and resume only when you're sure the main thread has focus.

- In the main thread, step INTO the new ArrayList(..) constructor and into "c.toArray(elementData)", and then step over "Iterator it=iterator();" (so that the debug pointer ends up on the next line with the for statement).
- Disable all breakpoints
- Resume the ProjectionSummary thread

Bug.WithStack:
3.0
The AnnotationModel manipulates the document's positions, its annotation map and its annotation model event unsynchronized. For example in AnnotationModel#addAnnotation(..), the following calls are not synchronized:
if (!fAnnotations.containsKey(annotation)) { addPosition(fDocument, position); fAnnotations.put(annotation, position); synchronized (getLockObject()) { getAnnotationModelEvent().annotationAdded(annotation); } ... Each call itself is using a lock object but some of the calls should be locked all together to guarantee atomic behavior.
Note: AnnotationModel.cleanup(boolean, boolean) has been changed in one of the 3.0 RCs: it can fire the model changed in a new thread. Attachments are not accessed in a thread-safe manner either. Found the following while running the test case from bug 77204 comment 5:
java.util.ConcurrentModificationException at java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextEntry(HashMap.java:782) at java.util.HashMap$KeyIterator.next(HashMap.java:818) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.AnnotationModel.getAnnotationIterator(AnnotationModel.java:504) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.AnnotationModel.getAnnotationIterator(AnnotationModel.java:482) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.projection.ProjectionSummary.removeSummaries(ProjectionSummary.java:193) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.projection.ProjectionSummary.internalUpdateSummaries(ProjectionSummary.java:166) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.projection.ProjectionSummary.access$3(ProjectionSummary.java:148) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.projection.ProjectionSummary$Summarizer.run(ProjectionSummary.java:70)
*** Bug 87568 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** I don't know if this helps, but I found a similar CME in my log (build I20050811-1530):
java.util.ConcurrentModificationException at java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextEntry(Unknown Source) at java.util.HashMap$KeyIterator.next(Unknown Source) at java.util.AbstractCollection.toArray(Unknown Source) at java.util.ArrayList.<init>(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.AnnotationMap.keySetIterator(AnnotationMap.java:76) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.AnnotationModel.getAnnotationIterator(AnnotationModel.java:570) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.AnnotationModel.getAnnotationIterator(AnnotationModel.java:550) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.AnnotationModel.getAnnotationIterator(AnnotationModel.java:530) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.OverviewRuler$FilterIterator.<init>(OverviewRuler.java:116) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.OverviewRuler.updateHeaderToolTipText(OverviewRuler.java:1237) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.OverviewRuler.updateHeader(OverviewRuler.java:1207) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.OverviewRuler.access$11(OverviewRuler.java:1170) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.OverviewRuler$5.run(OverviewRuler.java:685) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:123) ... 18 more

I'm getting this Exception in 3.2:
Exception in thread "Thread-9" java.util.ConcurrentModificationException at java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextEntry(HashMap.java:841) at java.util.HashMap$KeyIterator.next(HashMap.java:877) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.AnnotationModel.getAnnotationIterator(AnnotationModel.java:552) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.AnnotationModel.getAnnotationIterator(AnnotationModel.java:530) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.projection.ProjectionSummary.removeSummaries(ProjectionSummary.java:193) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.projection.ProjectionSummary.internalUpdateSummaries(ProjectionSummary.java:166) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.projection.ProjectionSummary.access$3(ProjectionSummary.java:148) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.projection.ProjectionSummary$Summarizer.run(ProjectionSummary.java:70) >What's the status of this bug, will it be fixed in a release? No. *** Bug 182995 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 184027 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 306523 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 60540 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** The problem is that ProjectionSummary.internalUpdateSummaries(IProgressMonitor) line: 164 can change the lock object of the AnnotationMap while the lock is already being taken. If another thread then synchronizes on the new lock, it gets free access to the same HashMap.
Steps to reproduce in HEAD:
- Set a breakpoint in ProjectionSummary#internalUpdateSummaries(..) at first call to "sync.setLockObject(..)" (line 164) - Set a breakpoint in BracketInserterTest#testMultiplePeerEntry() at 'type("((((");' (line 255)
- Debug BracketInserterTest#testMultiplePeerEntry() (only this single test method)
=> One of the suspended threads is in ProjectionSummary.internalUpdateSummaries(IProgressMonitor) line: 164 - Open the local variable 'sync' and write down the id of the field fAnnotations= AnnotationMap
- Set breakpoint in AnnotationMap#keySetIterator() inside the synchronized block (line 82) - Resume the main thread a few times until the 'this' variable has the id you've written down before. WARNING: The Debug view tries sometimes steals your selection and selects the ProjectionSummary thread (bug 229536). Be careful and resume only when you're sure the main thread has focus.
- In the main thread, step INTO the new ArrayList(..) constructor and into "c.toArray(elementData)", and then step over "Iterator it=iterator();" (so that the debug pointer ends up on the next line with the for statement). - Disable all breakpoints - Resume the ProjectionSummary thread
- In the main thread, you can now see that the modCount in the HashMap has changed. When you resume, you get this exception:

>Maybe we could also just synchronize on the document lock and avoid calling >setLockObject(..) at all. I think we should even go further and make sure that the visual model uses the same lock as the underlying model since they operate on the same document.
I will try that approach. Created attachment 176165 Patch for comment 15 Comment 16 looks good. This is in HEAD and I20100810-0800. Verified in I20100914-0100 and also verified that there are no impacts on performance. *** Bug 327555 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 350637 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 371122 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Bug.WithOutStack:
3.0
The AnnotationModel manipulates the document's positions, its annotation map and its annotation model event unsynchronized. For example in AnnotationModel#addAnnotation(..), the following calls are not synchronized:
if (!fAnnotations.containsKey(annotation)) { addPosition(fDocument, position); fAnnotations.put(annotation, position); synchronized (getLockObject()) { getAnnotationModelEvent().annotationAdded(annotation); } ... Each call itself is using a lock object but some of the calls should be locked all together to guarantee atomic behavior.
Note: AnnotationModel.cleanup(boolean, boolean) has been changed in one of the 3.0 RCs: it can fire the model changed in a new thread. Attachments are not accessed in a thread-safe manner either. Found the following while running the test case from bug 77204 comment 5:
*** Bug 87568 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** I don't know if this helps, but I found a similar CME in my log (build I20050811-1530):
... 18 more
FWIW, we saw the following during a run of bea internal tests:
[java] at java.util.ArrayList.<init>(ArrayList.java:137) [java] at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.AnnotationMap.keySetIterator(AnnotationMap.java:76) [java] at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.AnnotationModel.getAnnotationIterator(AnnotationModel.java:570) [java] at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.AnnotationModel.getAnnotationIterator(AnnotationModel.java:550) [java] at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.AnnotationModel.getAnnotationIterator(AnnotationModel.java:530) [java] at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.OverviewRuler$FilterIterator.<init>(OverviewRuler.java:116) [java] at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.OverviewRuler.updateHeaderToolTipText(OverviewRuler.java:1237) [java] at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.OverviewRuler.updateHeader(OverviewRuler.java:1207) [java] at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.OverviewRuler.access$11(OverviewRuler.java:1170) [java] at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.OverviewRuler$5.run(OverviewRuler.java:685) [java] at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35) [java] at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:123) [java] at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:3057) [java] at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2716) *** Bug 128147 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** What's the status of this bug, will it be fixed in a release? I'm getting this Exception in 3.2:
Exception in thread "Thread-9" java.util.ConcurrentModificationException at java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextEntry(HashMap.java:841) at java.util.HashMap$KeyIterator.next(HashMap.java:877) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.AnnotationModel.getAnnotationIterator(AnnotationModel.java:552) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.AnnotationModel.getAnnotationIterator(AnnotationModel.java:530) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.projection.ProjectionSummary.removeSummaries(ProjectionSummary.java:193) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.projection.ProjectionSummary.internalUpdateSummaries(ProjectionSummary.java:166) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.projection.ProjectionSummary.access$3(ProjectionSummary.java:148) at org.eclipse.jface.text.source.projection.ProjectionSummary$Summarizer.run(ProjectionSummary.java:70) >What's the status of this bug, will it be fixed in a release? No. *** Bug 182995 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 184027 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 306523 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 60540 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** The problem is that ProjectionSummary.internalUpdateSummaries(IProgressMonitor) line: 164 can change the lock object of the AnnotationMap while the lock is already being taken. If another thread then synchronizes on the new lock, it gets free access to the same HashMap.
Steps to reproduce in HEAD:
- Set a breakpoint in ProjectionSummary#internalUpdateSummaries(..) at first call to "sync.setLockObject(..)" (line 164) - Set a breakpoint in BracketInserterTest#testMultiplePeerEntry() at 'type("((((");' (line 255)
- Debug BracketInserterTest#testMultiplePeerEntry() (only this single test method)
=> One of the suspended threads is in ProjectionSummary.internalUpdateSummaries(IProgressMonitor) line: 164 - Open the local variable 'sync' and write down the id of the field fAnnotations= AnnotationMap
- Set breakpoint in AnnotationMap#keySetIterator() inside the synchronized block (line 82) - Resume the main thread a few times until the 'this' variable has the id you've written down before. WARNING: The Debug view tries sometimes steals your selection and selects the ProjectionSummary thread (bug 229536). Be careful and resume only when you're sure the main thread has focus.
- In the main thread, step INTO the new ArrayList(..) constructor and into "c.toArray(elementData)", and then step over "Iterator it=iterator();" (so that the debug pointer ends up on the next line with the for statement). - Disable all breakpoints - Resume the ProjectionSummary thread
- In the main thread, you can now see that the modCount in the HashMap has changed. When you resume, you get this exception:
... 50 more Created attachment 174013 Fix for ProjectionSummary
Here's a patch that fixes the problem in ProjectionSummary by synchronizing on the original lock object while the summary annotations are being updated. I didn't find problems with it and AllTextTests is still green with the patch.
Dani, could you please have a look? I did not yet look at the performance implications of this fix, but I think any solution needs to hold both locks Maybe we could also just synchronize on the document lock and avoid calling setLockObject(..) at all. re comment #13: good catch!
>Maybe we could also just synchronize on the document lock and avoid calling >setLockObject(..) at all. I think we should even go further and make sure that the visual model uses the same lock as the underlying model since they operate on the same document.
I will try that approach. Created attachment 176165 Patch for comment 15 Comment 16 looks good. This is in HEAD and I20100810-0800. Verified in I20100914-0100 and also verified that there are no impacts on performance. *** Bug 327555 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 350637 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 371122 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Bug.WithStack:
Checking out some modules in an existing project run well. Updating the project in resource view failed with an lock-error because of checking out CVSROOT. In our repositories the directory CVSROOT can't and shoudn't be checked out by a normal user. Concurrent Versions System (CVS) 1.11.5 (client/server) on Solaris drwxrwsr-x admin-user admin-group CVSROOT drwxrwxr-x normal-user normal-group bin CVSROOT\Emptydir drwxrwxr-x normal-user admin-group 96 Jul 5 10:45 Emptydir
I think the reason is, that update now, in opposite of eclipse 2.1.x, want to check out CVSROOT if the option 'fetch absent directories on update' is set. If the option is reset, it works.
What can be done to 'fetch absent directories on update' belonging to the modules checked out in the project but not all the absent modules in the repository including CVSROOT. Can you attach what appeared there as well? I've put these output in the last comment, perhaps not easy to see. You find it if you search for "c:\jdk1.3.1\jre\bin\java.exe". Right. I see it now. It looks like the .options file didn't have the right debug trace enablement. Did you add the debug enablement lines from the URL to file C:/Programme/eclipse 3.0M2/.options? The lines should be:
org.eclipse.team.cvs.core/debug=true org.eclipse.team.cvs.core/cvsprotocol=true

read lock failed - giving up There is something quite odd about the trac you have provided. You are checking out the module "eigener_test" and the checkout seems to have gone well. However, the update you are doing seems to be on a project that contain "eigener_test" asw a subdirectory. Is this correct? Can you give me the details of the operatios you performed so I can match them to the trace (i.e. the trace doesn't contain that information). It's right what you said. The user check out some modules from a repository to a project (here eigener_test from repository cvs_sudo_test in project cvs_sudo_test). After some time they want to make an update of all the modules checked out, so they make team update of the project, that means update all the modules included in the project (here update project cvs_sudo_test - and therefore update module eigener_test). And how did they create the project "cvs_sudo_test"? Create new project (file - new - project) - simple project - name the project - finish. Sorry, I should have stated my question better. How did the project get created and shared with the repository root (as it appears to be from the trace). It would be easiest if you gave me a complete explanation of all the steps that you take to cause the problem to happen and provide as much detail as possible. I could then match this up with the trace to determine where the problem is. There are only a few steps
cvs-view: - add a new cvs-repository (/cm/cvsstst/cvs_sudo_test) resource-view: - create a simple project (cvs_sudo_test) in my tests the project is named as the repository cvs-view: - expand the head (from cvs_sudo_test) - mark a module (eigener_test) - check out as - in an existing project this is checkout /cm/cvsstst/cvs_sudo_test/eigener_test in project cvs_sudo_test) resource-view: - mark project cvs_sudo_test - team update that's all
OK, I've figured out what is going wrong. The repository you are using is configured to provide a top level admin directory (i.e. the line "TopLevelAdmin=yes" appears in your CVSROOT/config file). When you do a checkout of the "eigener_test" module into the simple project, Eclipse is receiving the top level admin directory and assigning it to the parent project. Eclipse CVS does ignore the top-level-admin when it is checking out a project (i.e. when the admin directory is the root of the repository). However, it does not when the top-level-admin folder is a project or subfolder.
It's not clear to me what, if anything, we want to do here. The implication of configuring a repository to use topLevelAdmin is that the users will be able to perform an update on multiple projects but will not be able to use the -d option to fetch the absent directories. The current workarounds are to turn off topLevelAdmins, turn off fetch absent directories for the project or only perform updates on the subfolder that was checked out. Alternatively, the user could define a module in the CVSROOT/modules file that created a project that had the proper structure.
The problem would be lessened if the update command itself allowed the user to decide whether to fetch absent directories or not. I'm a litle late, but last week I wasn't here. First thank you for your answer. Now I need to discuss the situation here. For this, please can you tell me the reason why eclipse version 3... handles the situation in another way as version 2.1.x. Perhaps this will help us to find the right solution. Improvments were made to CVS checkout in 3.0. Unfortunately, these improvements had the unforseen consequences you are experiencing.

In our repositories the directory CVSROOT can't and shoudn't be checked out by a normal user. I think the reason is, that update now, in opposite of eclipse 2.1.x, want to check out CVSROOT if the option 'fetch absent directories on update' is set. If the option is reset, it works.
What can be done to 'fetch absent directories on update' belonging to the modules checked out in the project but not all the absent modules in the repository including CVSROOT. org.eclipse.team.cvs.core/debug=true org.eclipse.team.cvs.core/cvsprotocol=true
